      • hashPassword

        @NotNull
public static @NotNull java.lang.String hashPassword(java.lang.String password_plaintext)
        This method can be used to generate a string representing an account password suitable for storing in a database. It will be an OpenBSD-style crypt(3) formatted hash string of length=60 The BCrypt workload is specified in the above static variable, a value from 10 to 31. A workload of 12 is a very reasonable safe default as of 2013. This automatically handles secure 128-bit salt generation and storage within the hash.
        Parameters:
        password_plaintext - The account's plaintext password as provided during account creation, or when changing an account's password.
        Returns:
        String - a string of length 60 that is the BCrypt hashed password in crypt(3) format.

      • checkPassword

        public static boolean checkPassword(java.lang.String password_plaintext,
                                    java.lang.String stored_hash)
        This method can be used to verify a computed hash from a plaintext (e.g. during a login request) with that of a stored hash from a database. The password hash from the database must be passed as the second variable.
        Parameters:
        password_plaintext - The account's plaintext password, as provided during a login request
        stored_hash - The account's stored password hash, retrieved from the authorization database
        Returns:
        boolean - true if the password matches the password of the stored hash, false otherwise
